comments.body: To be consistent, you should also use array_ops.shape() to extract rows_in, cols_in, and channels

comments.body: Thanks for the contribution, this looks pretty good. Can you add a regression test to make sure the code is correct? You can use https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/tensorflow/python/kernel_tests/conv2d_backprop_filter_grad_test.py#L25 as an example.

Looks like in python 3 PIP setups, there is a problem caused by these lines.
It looks like "padding" can be something other than 'SAME' or 'VALID'
any ideas what might be happening?

http://ci.tensorflow.org/view/Tensorflow%20Jenkins%20Monitored%20builds/job/nightly-matrix-cpu/TF_BUILD_CONTAINER_TYPE=CPU,TF_BUILD_IS_OPT=OPT,TF_BUILD_IS_PIP=PIP,TF_BUILD_PYTHON_VERSION=PYTHON3,label=cpu-slave/194/consoleFull

  elif padding == 'VALID':
    rows_out = int(ceil((rows_in - ksize_r_eff + 1) / stride_r))
    cols_out = int(ceil((cols_in - ksize_c_eff + 1) / stride_h))
